Sentencas: This work reports the development of a novel high temperature, optically-accessed experimental facility and optical methods for Solid Oxide Fuel Cell (SOFC) research at the University of British Columbia (UBC).
Titulo: High-temperature vibrational Raman spectroscopy of gaseous species for solid-oxide fuel cell research

Sentencas: Vibrational Raman spectroscopy is applied to determine the flow-wise distributions of key gaseous species in a model Direct Internal Reforming (DIR) SOFC reformer fuelled with methane at operating temperatures of 600 and 700 degrees C.
Titulo: High-temperature vibrational Raman spectroscopy of gaseous species for solid-oxide fuel cell research

Sentencas: This work describes key aspects of the rig design for high temperature operation and details the in-situ calibration methodology developed to allow results to be reported in terms of mole fraction.
Titulo: High-temperature vibrational Raman spectroscopy of gaseous species for solid-oxide fuel cell research

Sentencas: A sample set of experimental results is presented and discussed.
Titulo: High-temperature vibrational Raman spectroscopy of gaseous species for solid-oxide fuel cell research

Sentencas: Elements of the reformer design and the operating characteristics of the apparatus that directly influence the results are identified.
Titulo: High-temperature vibrational Raman spectroscopy of gaseous species for solid-oxide fuel cell research

Sentencas: Potential applications of the apparatus are described.
Titulo: High-temperature vibrational Raman spectroscopy of gaseous species for solid-oxide fuel cell research
